neighbors.name: Steven Torres
neighbors.claims: Steven Torres (also listed in records as Stephen D. Torres) is approximately 75 years old and resides in the Surprise area of Maricopa County [MenStoppingViolence](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/stephen-torres/). No record of him serving in any local public office or speaking out in community meetings on development issues could be located in available public sources (indicating he has kept a low civic profile).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Steven Torres through personal outreach by a project representative, focusing on listening to any concerns. Build trust by emphasizing transparency and showing respect for his property rights and desire for quiet enjoyment of his land.

neighbors.name: Cecil Moreno & Veronica Rodriguez
neighbors.claims: Veronica Rodriguez Moreno, co-owner of the parcel with Cecil Moreno, passed away from illness in February 2022 at the age of 53, and was married to Cecil Moreno Sr ([www.dignitymemorial.com](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/tolleson-az/veronica-moreno-10578608#:~:text=On%20February%202%2C%202022%20Veronica,Moreno%2C%20Cecil%20Jeremy%20Moreno%20and)). Cecil Moreno (her surviving husband) has not been identified in any public leadership positions or news reports related to local development or energy projects, suggesting he has no known public stance and remains a private community member.
neighbors.influence_justification: No public profile or leadership roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach the Moreno family with empathy and personal rapport – perhaps via a mutual acquaintance or community liaison – acknowledging their family’s recent loss. Emphasize respectful communication and ask about any concerns they have regarding changes in the area.

neighbors.name: Joseph Stephenson
neighbors.claims: Joseph Stephenson is listed as the owner of a parcel in unincorporated Maricopa County (APN 40035396), but there is no public information indicating any civic roles or statements from him regarding local development. Searches of local records and media yielded no references to Stephenson taking part in community meetings or activism on development issues (implying a low-profile, private presence).

approach_recommendations.engage: Since Mr. Stephenson’s views are not publicly known, a one-on-one meeting led by the project outreach team would be ideal to learn his perspective. Approach him with open-ended questions about his priorities (e.g., property upkeep, privacy) and highlight any project benefits addressing those areas.

overview_summary: None of the three profiled neighboring landowners have a documented stance in favor of or against the development project, as no public statements or actions indicating support or opposition were found. All appear to have low public profiles in the community – none hold elected office or prominent leadership roles – suggesting limited direct influence on local policy or opinion.
